item.description:
Turtleback Mountain is next in our series of Ossipee Range hikes...

Turtleback offers incredible views of Lake Winnipesaukee and the surrounding mountains and countryside. At 2200' it's less difficult than Mount Roberts, but will give us a good chance to stretch our legs and enjoy some amazing scenery.

And on the way back, we'll detour through the Shannon Brook waterfall area. The waterfalls are a  wonderland of cascading crystal streams. Last time we came here there was a foot of fresh snow on the ground. This time we'll have a chance to refresh ourselves in the cool water after a good hike.

We'll hike to a granite ledge lookout point with views across Lake Winnipesaukee and out to the Belknap Range. We'll pass through the grounds of Castle in the Clouds, an Arts & Crafts-style estate owned by the Lakes Region Conservation Trust. And our route along Shannon Brook will bring us past coursing streams and crystal waterfalls.

Trails vary from wide & flat to rocky & steep. This will be a moderate hike with a few short steep sections - and the views are incredible!

It's about 3.5 miles each way with 1,000' elevation gain. We should be on the trail for about 4 hours including stops.

Bring something to eat for the hike but...

We'll stop at Poor
People's Pub on the way home. The food is good and the service even better. It's located on RT 109 in Sanbornville half a mile east of Rt 16.

CARPOOL: 10 AM @ Dover CJ Trailways Park & Ride Spaulding Tpk north to Exit 9 - Left @ light - then Left @ 2nd light.Please share expenses with your driver.

Trailhead: Follow Rt 16 north to Rt 171 (~36mi from Dover exit 9). Turn LEFT & follow Rt 171 for 14 miles from Rt 16. GO PAST the entrance to Castle in the Clouds and take the next right at Ossipee Park Rd. Parking area is a mile or two up. Drive time from Dover is ~65 minutes.

No Pets.

The Ossipee Mountain range is a circular wilderness that rises 2000'-3000' directly above Lake Winnipesaukee. Views of the lake, the White Mountains, and the surrounding countryside are absolutely breathtaking.The isolated and undeveloped mass of the Ossipee range is the largest and least disturbed wildlife habitat in the region. The range is 9 miles in diameter, its tallest summit rising to an elevation of 2,975 feet. The Ossipees consist of a circular land mass of more than 40,000 acres, accessed by only three interior roads, none of which bisect the area.

There are 25 named mountains and dozens of unnamed summits within the range; 16 named brooks originate in the Ossipees, while scores of smaller watercourses create ravines within its borders. The biodiversity of this land has been largely unaffected by human hands, to the great benefit and proliferation of the species inside its borders. Old growth trees dating back to the 1590’s have been discovered, and more than a score of species deemed endangered or threatened on a statewide to global scale have been identified.

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

*Unless otherwise specified, refunds for timely cancellations may be processed the day after the event.

*Time and location are subject to change due to weather and other factors.  Always check email & this listing for updates before leaving home.

item.how_to_find_us: MEET in the parking area at the top of Ossipee Park Rd.
item.name: Turtleback Views, & Brews
